meanings.definition: To infuse again with a substance or quality.
meanings.sent1: After the tea cooled down, she decided to reinfuse it with fresh mint leaves.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to reinfuse her artwork with more vibrant colors to make it stand out.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reinfuse the old cake with new flavor turned out to be a delicious experiment.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to reinfuse his paintings with the passion he once felt.
meanings.sent5: The chef knew that to reinfuse the dish with flavor, he needed to add more spices.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to reinfuse excitement into the classroom after a long break.
meanings.sent2: He tried to reinfuse energy into the team by giving them a motivational speech.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to reinfuse wonder into the audience with each performance.
meanings.sent4: The coach aimed to reinfuse determination into the players before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller knew how to reinfuse suspense into the plot to keep the listeners engaged.
